newsitem.title: FRANCE: France's Tapie to leave jail for day work.
newsitem.headline: France's Tapie to leave jail for day work.

text.p: French ex-soccer boss Bernard Tapie will start work on Monday as a salesman after a court on Friday allowed him to leave the prison where he is serving an eight-month term for rigging a game, his lawyer said.
Lawyer Henri Bollet told TF1 television that the court in the southern town of Aix-en-Provence had allowed Tapie to leave the jail during the day after he produced a six-month work contract.
Under French law, prisoners serving short terms may be allowed out of prison during the day if they find employment.
Tapie was hired for six months by a shipyard boss, Michel Bigoin, who once was part of the management of Tapie's former Marseille soccer club.
Tapie entered prison on February 3 after the supreme court rejected his appeal against imprisonment for rigging a league match between Marseille and Valenciennes in 1993.
He has appealed against another, six-month term for tax evasion regarding his luxury yacht.
